intro: Quararibea lopezperaltae, commonly known as the Lopezparalta's quina, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Amazon rainforest, specifically in parts of Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four to five petals. It produces small, dark blue berries that are edible and have a mildly bitter taste. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
